attributes.action: Have a Public vote on UK involvement in any conflict in Ukraine or Taiwan.
attributes.additional_details:
Too many lives have been lost fighting other in countries wars. The tax payers are paying for the freedom of other nations while we suffer with cuts to all manner of services and the increase in tax and bills. 
We are not in a position to help others when we can not help ourselves. 
Put the uk public first and let them decide if we can afford to help.
attributes.background: I would like the government to put it to the people of the UK, before we commit to another conflict overseas, the public get to vote on if we as a nation are involved and the kind of involvement ie military or foreign aid.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. We're not sure if you want a referendum for any UK military action, or just in specified countries. 

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
